newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan December offshore banking unit assets rise.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan December offshore banking unit assets rise.

text.p: The combined assets of Taiwan's 65 offshore banking units grew 9.0 percent to a new high of US$36.59 billion at the end of December from a year earlier, the central bank said on Monday.
About 77 percent of the assets, held by 36 local banks and 29 foreign banks, came from Asia and the rest from Europe and America, the bank said in a statement.
The statement added that the bank had recently approved four more offshore banking unit applications by foreign banks and one more by a local bank.
In December, Taiwan's offshore banking units reported a monthly foreign exchange turnover of $3.742 billion, the statement said.

Of the derivatives operated by theese units, margin trading accounted for $403 million, options $282 million, financial futures accounted for $72 million, interest rate swaps took $51 million and forward interest rate agreements took $5 million.

The government has planned to expand the offshore banking unit business as part of its scheme to become a regional financial centre. This expansion would herald some tax burden for these units, although its size is still unspecified, officials have said.
